net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.field.adapter

Class UiWidgetAdapterGwtField<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget,VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.adapter.AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<WIDGET>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.adapter.AbstractUiWidgetAdapterWithEvents<WIDGET,EventAdapterGwt>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterGwt<WIDGET>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidget<WIDGET>
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidgetActive<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
              • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.gwt.widget.field.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterGwtField<WIDGET,VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>
  • Type Parameters:
    WIDGET - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget().
    VALUE - is the generic type of the changed value.
    ADAPTER_VALUE - is the generic type of the value of the adapted widget.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAltText, AttributeReadAttribute, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHeightInRows, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeReadKeyboardFilter, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadLengthProperty, AttributeReadMaximumTextLength, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadUrl, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeReadValueAsString, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAttribute, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeWriteKeyboardFilter, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeWriteOnlyAttribute, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, AttributeWriteValueAsString, UiWidgetAdapter, UiWidgetAdapterActive, UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>, HandlerRegistrationCollector, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadMaximumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>, Accessibility
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetAdapterGwtDateField, UiWidgetAdapterGwtFieldFocusWidgetBase, UiWidgetAdapterGwtFileField, UiWidgetAdapterGwtRadioButtons, UiWidgetAdapterGwtRichTextField

    public abstract class UiWidgetAdapterGwtField<WIDGET extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget,VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>
extends UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidgetActive<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
implements UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>, AttributeReadMaximumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>
    This is the implementation of UiWidgetAdapterField using GWT.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • setMode

        public void setMode(boolean editMode)
        This method is called from UiModeChanger for AttributeWriteMode.setMode(net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common.UiMode). It only handles the predefined UiModes.
        Specified by:
        setMode in interface UiWidgetAdapter
        Overrides:
        setMode in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
        Parameters:
        editMode - - true of UiMode.EDIT and false for UiMode.VIEW.

      • updateWidgetViewMode

        protected void updateWidgetViewMode()
        This method updates the view-mode-widget such that it displays the current value.

      • setAdapterValueInViewMode

        protected void setAdapterValueInViewMode(ADAPTER_VALUE value)
        This method updates the view-mode-widget such that it displays the given value. By default a label is created for view-mode. If you change this you will also need to override this method to properly apply the value.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to display.

      • setValueInViewMode

        protected void setValueInViewMode(String value)
        This method updates the view-mode-widget such that it displays the given value. By default a label is created for view-mode. If you change this you will also need to override this method to properly apply the value.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to display.

      • getValueAsString

        public String getValueAsString()
        This method gets the value as String. It returns the value as it is entered by the end-user that may be invalid.
        Specified by:
        getValueAsString in interface AttributeReadValueAsString
        Returns:
        the value as entered by the user. Will be the empty String if the field is blank.

      • setValueAsString

        public void setValueAsString(String value)
        This method sets the valueAsString of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        This method shall only be used in very specific situations. Use it e.g. if you explicitly want to enter invalid data.
        Specified by:
        setValueAsString in interface AttributeWriteValueAsString
        Parameters:
        value - is the new value as it would have been entered by the user.

      • createToplevelWidget

        protected final com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget createToplevelWidget()
        This method creates the underlying widget.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is called from the constructor but implemented in sub-classes. You should NOT access or even modify member variables as they are NOT set at this point (even final members). However, this design is done by intention instead of passing the widget as constructor argument to give more flexibility by overriding and also for potential lazy initialization of the widget.
        Specified by:
        createToplevelWidget in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
        Returns:
        a new instance of the underlying widget.

      • getWidgetViewMode

        protected final com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget getWidgetViewMode()
        Returns:
        the widget for the view-mode.

      • createViewWidget

        protected com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget createViewWidget()
        Creates the Widget that is used to display the field value in view-mode. If you override this method and change the widget type you will also need to override updateWidgetViewMode().
        Returns:
        a new view Widget.

      • getActiveWidget

        public final WIDGET getActiveWidget()
        Description copied from class: UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidget
        This method gets the active widget. For simple cases this will be the same as AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget(). In more complex scenarios the toplevel widget may only be a container widget and this method returns a child that represents the active part.
        Overrides:
        getActiveWidget in class UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidget<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
        Returns:
        the widget for the edit-mode.

      • attachActiveWidget

        protected void attachActiveWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel panel)
        Attaches the active widget after creation to AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget(). May be overridden for composed active widgets.
        Parameters:
        panel - is the ComplexPanel (see AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getToplevelWidget()) where to attach.

      • createActiveWidget

        protected abstract WIDGET createActiveWidget()
        Returns:
        a new Widget that is used to display and modify the field value in edit-mode.

      • getInputElement

        protected com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element getInputElement()
        Returns:
        the input Element representing the actual editable field.

      • setValidationFailure

        public void setValidationFailure(String validationFailure)
        This method sets the validation failure.
        ATTENTION:
        For regular usage you should use UiFeatureValidation. This method is only intended as back-door for very special cases (e.g. you have to use your own validator infrastructure and perform validation outside this framework). It is not recommended to use this method as an API user.
        Specified by:
        setValidationFailure in interface AttributeWriteValidationFailure
        Parameters:
        validationFailure - is the validation failure text. The empty string or null will clear the error and mark the field as valid. Otherwise the field will be invalid.

      • getMinimumValue

        public ADAPTER_VALUE getMinimumValue()
        This method gets the minimum value of this object. A legal value has to be greater or equal to this minimum.
        Specified by:
        getMinimumValue in interface AttributeReadMinimumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>
        Returns:
        the minimum allowed for value or null if unbounded.

      • getMaximumValue

        public ADAPTER_VALUE getMaximumValue()
        This method gets the maximum value of this object. A legal value has to be less or equal to this maximum.
        Specified by:
        getMaximumValue in interface AttributeReadMaximumValue<ADAPTER_VALUE>
        Returns:
        the maximum allowed for value or null if unbounded.
